screensframework

Class StaffExportController

  • java.lang.Object
    • screensframework.StaffExportController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable, ControlledScreen

    public class StaffExportController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable, ControlledScreen
    FXML Controller class for the staff export page. This page provides two export functionalities. 1) An employee may select a film and export it's json data to a csv file. The number of free and booked seats are also calculated for each listing as it is not available in the database. 2) An employee may export all data from json to csv in addition to all film listings and number of free and booked seats.
    Author:
    Fraz Ahmad

      • initialize

        public void initialize(java.net.URL location,
                       java.util.ResourceBundle resources)
        Initialises the controller class. A list of films is added to a film drop-down menu so that a user may select a specific film to export.
        Specified by:

      • getSelectedFilmDetailsToCSV

        public void getSelectedFilmDetailsToCSV(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Exports film details of a specified film from a json arrays to csv file. Number of booked and free seats of a specified film are also calculated.
        Parameters:
        event - the Employee has clicked the export button.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the database file could not be found.

      • getDatabaseToCSV

        public void getDatabaseToCSV(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Exports entire database into a csv file. Also the number of booked and free seats for each of the films are also added.
        Parameters:
        event - the user chooses to export the entire database.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the database file could not be found.
